name: Curta-metragem "Morro Aos Poucos Em Todos Aqueles Que Gostam De Mim"
headline: Um curta para explorar a dissolução da esquerda e da direita no Brasil atual.
budget: O orçamento para projetos anteriores a 24/02/2015 normalmente pode ser encontrado na descrição acima.
about_html:
Olá! Meu nome é Roberto Curan. Sou aluno de 6o semestre da faculdade de Cinema da FAAP, em São Paulo, no Brasil. O meu projeto de curta-metragem, chamado “Morro Aos Poucos Em Todos Aqueles Que Gostam De Mim” foi aprovado em aula, e o objetivo dessa campanha é arrecadar verba pra realizar o filme, ainda esse semestre.

Apesar de ser um projeto acadêmico, a ambição desse trabalho e da minha equipe é de produzir um curta profissional, que nos aproxime cada vez mais da nossa futura carreira de cineastas. Todo o equipamento (de foto, de luz, de som), é fornecido pela faculdade. Um detalhe interessante é que rodaremos o filme em 16mm, uma oportunidade única nos dias de hoje. Apesar disso, todos os outros gastos de produção são por conta minha e da minha equipe. Isso inclui o aluguel de um quarto de hotel, transporte e alimentação, figurino e maquiagem e, o mais importante, o cachê dos atores. Acho de extrema importância remunerá-los não de forma simbólica, mas sim um pouco mais justa, porque o trabalho deles é a base para esse filme.

Sinopse resumida: São Paulo. Dia de manifestação popular contra a Copa do Mundo. Um encontro inesperado entre um EXECUTIVO e um JOVEM de mundos politicamente opostos os levará a uma conexão física e emocional, capaz de fazê-los refletir sobre os seus próprios ideais.

Para uma sinopse mais detalhada, além de objetivos e justificativas do projeto, assista ao vídeo :)

Lista de gastos: - Aluguel de três diárias do quarto de hotel: R$ 1500,00 - Cachê dos atores: R$ 1200,00 - Maquiagem/figurino: R$ 150,00 - Transporte/Alimentação: R$ 400,00 - Taxa Catarse: +- R$ 450,00

Conheça a equipe: 1. Roberto Curan – Roteiro e Direção 2. Carla Plascak – Assistência de Direção 3. Arthur Carneiro – Diretor de Fotografia 4. Isadora Veríssimo – Direção de Som 5. Adriana Gaspar – Direção de Arte 6. Bob Yang e Julia Prados – Produção

Em geral, é isso! Qualquer colaboração é muito bem-vinda. Realizar este projeto será um conquista para mim e para toda a equipe. Com a ajuda de vocês, contaremos uma história que precisa chegar ao mundo.

Dúvidas: morroaospoucos@gmail.com

Ah, e explicando o título: ele é uma citação do Rousseau, mencionado ao longo do curta.

Beijos, abraços, e até breve!

ENGLISH (video + text above)

Hello, there. I´m Roberto Curan, a cinema student at FAAP, a Brazilian university in São Paulo. Recently, my short-film project, named “Morro Aos Poucos Em Todos Aqueles Que Gostam De Mim” (translates to something like “a part of me dies in anyone who ever likes me”) was selected to be produced. The reason for this campaign is to fundraise for the production of the film (we are filming it at the end of this semester).

My crew and I are very passionate about this project and see it as much more than just an academic project. Our goal is to create a professional short-film, which we hope will also help us in our future filmmaker professions. All of the equipment (camera, light, etc) will be provided by the university. We are filming in 16mm, something rare nowadays. Other than this, however, my group and I are responsible for all additional costs. This includes renting a hotel room, paying for transportation, food, makeup, and most importantly paying the actors. I see them as the main key of my film, so remunerating them in a fair way is the least I could do.

Here is the film’s synopsis: São Paulo, Brazil. A public manifestation against the World Cup is going on in the streets. A wealthy and well-accomplished middle-aged BUSSINESSMAN is in a hotel room with the intention of killing himself. After being disturbed by a loud noise outside of his room, he finds a 20-something year old PROTESTER injured and knocked out at his door, and, by lack of option, he shelters the young man. From this “forced” and uncomfortable enclosure, both men start a timid dialogue that slowly converts into a more intimate connection. Within the confrontation between their distinctly different political perspectives, the PROTESTER subtly starts a seduction game, which will make the BUSSINESSMAN rethink his future all over again.

The main intention of “Morro Aos Poucos…” is to raise the issue of the recent social manifestations in Brazil, but in a less didactic way and in a more human and personal way. Through an unexpected encounter, the movie will construct a visible parallel between a right wing much more intelligent than what it appears to be (but trapped in its conservatism and in its average men anguishes) and a left wing loaded of utopia and transformation dreams (but that can be much more cruel and seductive than what it appears to be). In general, the movie intends to show the dissolution between left and right through a timid, but sexualized, encounter of two men sculptured by the stereotypes of their universes.

And why do I want to shoot this movie? Because it talks about a personal restlessness, which is actually a general restlessness that is felt by my entire generation. The political boundary between left and right is now really present in the Brazilian society, due to the recent manifestations that spread in our streets. But this boundary is also a confusing theme for me, and to solidify a project that talks about it feels really necessary for. Also, there is another personal restlessness (which, once more, is actually spread all over modern society): how to physically and emotionally relate to another human being in such a moralist society?

Well, I think that’s all. The desire in shooting this film is REALLY big, one of my dreams. My team has a story to tell and it needs to reach the world. If you have any doubts, please write to morroaospoucos@gmail.com

Information about costs: - Rent of the hotel room (3 days) : R$ 1500,00 - Payment of the actors: R$ 1200,00 - Make-up/Costumes: R$ 150,00 - Food/Transport: R$ 400,00 - Catarse's taxes: +- R$ 450,00

The crew: 1. Roberto Curan – Writer and Director 2. Carla Plascak – Assistant Director 3. Arthur Carneiro – Director Of Photography 4. Isadora Veríssimo – Director of Audiography 5. Adriana Gaspar – Art Director 6. Bob Yang e Julia Prados – Film Producers

Ah, and explaining the title of the project: it is a quote by Rousseau (who is mentioned during the film), one of the fathers of Socialism.

Thank you so much for your time, and please help me with whatever you can! :)
